visualizer_tools module

This module includes all visualizer tools used in the visualizer module.

@author: Ketil

visualizer_tools.get_vbounds(field, robust=True, min_quantile=0.0, max_quantile=0.98)

Get colorbar bounds given a field of data and the minimum and maximum quantile to cap the bounds at.

Parameters

  • field (xarray dataset) – An xarray dataset containing some data.

  • robust (bool, optional) – Wether or not to use the given quantiles, by default True

  • min_quantile (float, optional) – Quantile of data to set the min bound at, by default 0.00

  • max_quantile (float, optional) – Quantile of data to set the max bound at, by default 0.98

Returns

(vmin, vmax)

Return type

tuple

visualizer_tools.make_movie(dir_name, name, duration, filetype)

Make a movie (.gif) out of the images in a certain directory.

Parameters

  • dir_name (str) – Directory name. Where to look for images.

  • name (str) – Name of images to find.

  • duration (float) – Duration of each frame on screen.

  • filetype (str) – Filetype of images to find.

visualizer_tools.plot_field(field, xcoord='x', ycoord='y', robust=False, vmin=None, vmax=None, levels=25, logscale=False, method=None, ax=None)
class visualizer_tools.plot_global_velocity_location(config=None)

Bases: object

in_hull(hull, query_points)

Check if query points are inside the convex hull defined by a set of points. Thanks to the helpful people at https://stackoverflow.com/questions/16750618/whats-an-efficient-way-to-find-if-a-point-lies-in-the-convex-hull-of-a-point-cl for the algorithm.

Parameters

  • hull (array or Delaunay object) – An MxK array of M points in K dimensions of points defining a convex hull or a scipy.spatial.Delaunay object.

  • query_points (array) – A set of points to query. Should be an NxK array coordinates of N points in K dimensions.

Returns

Boolean array.

Return type

array

noneplot()

Do not plot anything.

plot(linestyle='-', linewidth=2, color='r', ax=None)

Plot the convex hull of the velocity.

Parameters

  • linestyle (str, optional) – Linestyle, by default ‘-‘

  • linewidth (int, optional) – Linewidth, by default 2

  • color (str, optional) – Color, by default ‘r’

  • ax (object, optional) – What axes object to plot to, by default None
